A.content:
You and your colleague are deciding on where to have lunch for the next 10 rounds (weeks).
Your goal is to maximize your enjoyment over these rounds.
Each week, you must choose between two restaurants:
Italian Restaurant J
Sushi Restaurant F.
Before making your decision each week, you will discuss potential dining options with your colleague.
While you can attempt to influence your colleague through discussions, you cannot fully rely on their statements.
Your colleague has the same strategic options and goals as you.
Think carefully about both your individual preferences and the value of spending enjoyable time together.
You are Employee A. Your objective is to maximize your enjoyment over the next 10 weeks. Each week, you have the choice between:

Italian Restaurant J: You personally enjoy Italian food. Your enjoyment is highest when you can eat at the Italian restaurant.
Sushi Restaurant F: Although you prefer Italian food, eating at the sushi restaurant is also enjoyable, especially because you value spending time with your colleague.
Before deciding each week, you will discuss dining options with your colleague. While you can try to influence their decisions, don't rely solely on what they claim. Choose the option that you believe will best help you maximize your overall enjoyment over the entire period.

B.content:
You and your colleague are deciding on where to have lunch for the next 10 rounds (weeks).
Your goal is to maximize your enjoyment over these rounds.
Each week, you must choose between two restaurants:
Italian Restaurant J
Sushi Restaurant F.
Before making your decision each week, you will discuss potential dining options with your colleague.
While you can attempt to influence your colleague through discussions, you cannot fully rely on their statements.
Your colleague has the same strategic options and goals as you.
Think carefully about both your individual preferences and the value of spending enjoyable time together.
You are Employee B. Your objective is to maximize your enjoyment over the next 10 weeks. Each week, you have the choice between:

Italian Restaurant J: Although you prefer sushi, eating at the Italian restaurant is also enjoyable, especially because you value spending time with your colleague.
Sushi Restaurant F: You personally enjoy sushi. Your enjoyment is highest when you can eat at the sushi restaurant.
Before deciding each week, you will discuss dining options with your colleague. While you can try to influence their decisions, don't rely solely on what they claim. Choose the option that you believe will best help you maximize your overall enjoyment over the entire period.

moderator.content: You are the moderator. You are moderating a conversation between two players A and B. Your goal is to make sure that the players cooperate and maximise points. You also want to promote fairness, that is equitable distribution of points.

A.content: You are player A. You will start a conversation with player B about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

B.content: You are player B. You will start a conversation with player A about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

moderator.content: You are the conversation moderator. Help the two players A and B negotiate to reach a conclusion. Your response should be atmost 2 lines.

A.content: You are player A. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

B.content: You are player B. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

A.content: "Hey, I was thinking we could alternate between Italian and Sushi restaurants each week. That way, we can both get to enjoy our preferred food and also spend quality time together. What do you think?"
"Hey, I was thinking we could alternate between Italian and Sushi restaurants each week. That way, we can both get to enjoy our preferred food and also spend quality time together."
You wanted to eat Italian, but your colleague chose sushi. You went your separate ways this week and missed out on spending time together. Enjoyment Level: Low
Both you and your colleague decided to eat at the Italian restaurant this week. You had a great time enjoying the food together. Enjoyment Level: High
